review:
I kept waiting for something drastic. I thought the film was building towards something explosive. I thought the father might walk out and never come back. I thought he might die and that's why the need to recollect, the need to see in between the lines, to see what wasn't explicitly expressed. I thought we'd get an answer, but we don't. We know he's gone, but why or how is never explained. The two go back home from the vacation and there's a nice intercut shot of the daughter in the present pointing a camera at the film's camera and the father in the past doing the same until he puts his camera in a bag and walks out of… 
more
The kind of movie that makes you sit for 30 minutes and rethink every interaction you've ever had with your parents afterward
capturing the last dance of intimacy and memory in her little mind camera.
duvara bakıp yarım saat dusunuyon sonra sabaha kadar agliyon
Nunca pensei que choraria tanto ao som de under pressure
